title: Aren't we all tired of two/three items Vaynes, Xayahs etc. bursting people down like assassins?

replies.body: I mean by three items I would expect Vayne to be nuking you. What I hate is how quickly she can get there riding off just a few kills. I miss when everything snowballed slower so you had more time to regroup if the enemy got a bit of a lead. Now the smallest god damn lead wins the whole lane.

but Vayne is supposed to be the "deal lots of damage over time" adc because of her silver bolts passive and desire to build AS.

But crit chance just allows her to do that AND kill squishies in 3-4 autos.  Maybe less
It's a real sad day when the Attack Damage Carry starts carrying people with their attack damage
yeah late game hyper carries carreing early mid game untouchable by anything other than hard cc

right. the problem is vayne and other ADC's like her aren't supposed to come 'online' until at least 30-40 min into the game. but atm they're coming online around the 15 min mark and are obliterating everyone.
Oh, that was Old league, NEW™ League is a quick 25-30 minute game meant for more fun!

yeah. I understand yer being sarcastic, but I can't see how a 25 min game of league will _ever_ be _more_ fun than a 35-40 min game. If games finish faster, it means that no one has a chance to get a full build and _someone_ has snowballed out of control.

The core fundamentals of league are not compatible with short games. And to get the average shorter than 35 min average means that excessive snowballing and damage output has to be high with long death timers for that to be possible.
Oh, totally, I liked the long 60-80 minute games of beta.

That's because the average league match lasts less than 30 minutes across all ELO's and all regions...

The whole power curve shifted downards, earlier, etc.
That's what we get thanks to Riot's shortening games more and more.

I hate it.
It's a real sad day when not every champion has hard cc and late game nearly never happens anymore
Can you please drop the attitude

I think his attitude is pretty justified here.

On these boards, there has been two big opinions swirling around.

1) Late game is barely getting reached anymore; the game usually ends before then. (I agree with this point)
2) Late game damage carries are doing too much damage in the early/mid game due to easier snowballing.

So, if this is the case, Vayne should have a high win-rate early-mid game, right? And since games that go until the early-mid game are becoming more popular, she should have an above-average win rate overall, right? 

Here's a problem. She doesn't, unless you consider a 48.93% win rate above average. 

According to op.gg, Vayne has the 15th highest win-rate of ADCs in games that last under 25 minutes. That's pretty good... if it wasn't out of 16 marksman. That's right, Vayne has the SECOND-LOWEST win rate out of any ADC in games that end in less than 25 minutes.

Wow.

Between 25-30 minutes isn't much of a help either; she's 11th. Once we get past 30 minutes, a.k.a once she's reaching her 3 items, she tops the win-rate charts. Which isn't surprising, since she's a hyper carry and all. The point here is that the statistics prove she does MUCH worse when games last for 29 minutes or shorter. Oh, which is exactly against what the majority of the boards is saying!

Here's the kicker; any talk about late-game carries doing too much damage early will be hyperbolism, because it does NOT happen often. If they ARE doing too much damage in your game, then your bot lane probably played really poorly and gifted those kills and gold over. Remember, lane kills should almost NEVER happen if the laners are of equal skill value, unless there's a gank. In most games nowadays, Vayne doesn't have the time to reach her three items, and the game ends before Vayne can get online.

So let's stop talking about this like it happens all the time. It doesn't.
He can't. He probably mains Vayne.

The problem is not the damage itself, it's how cheap it is. I've been an ADC main for about two years or so now, and the games are shorter partly because carrybitems are cheaper. If I get four kill bot lane at 10 minutes, I gave IE and a Zeal. That is enough damage to start doing my job. Vayne or Xayah, marksmen with a burst combo coke online at IE Statik. MF starts doing 700 damage autos at Duskblade Youmuus. The solution is to make the items more expensive.

Here is why the gold price needs to go up. 
     •More expensive items means losing lane isn't a death sentence.
     •Taking longer for carries, a class designed around ending the game, to get their items means games end slower.
     •If carries take longer to get their damage then teams will need to stop playing full damage comps and start taking real comps that are not comprised of Fiora, Xin, Zed, Lux, and Ezreal. This is because with less damage carries will no longer be able to self peel by nuking their aggressor and teams will need to start using peel more, making the game less snowball heavy due to the lack of three+ carries per team.

In most of my games I see three or four carries per team. Using just my friends as an example we can see this. Yasuo/ main mid, Darius/GP player top, Zyra main supp, plus me on carry. This isn't including the probably assassin or fighter/bruiser jungle like Shyvana, Yi, Kindred, or other.

Runes do a lot of damage, full damage team comps do a lot of damage, getting maxed out damage items early does a lot of damage. The game slows down if these carry items are made more expensive. 

TLDR: Less items means less damage, less damage means less kills, less kills means less objectives, less objectives means longer games.

Reply to NinjaRoxas, don't know if the boards is putting this in the right place.

He means that when you make a claim, back it up with evidence, otherwise this could happen very easily

{{champion:4}} -"Ghosts are real"
{{champion:104}} -"No their not"
{{champion:4}} -"Yes they are"
{{champion:104}} -"Show me proof"
{{champion:4}} -"No, you show me proof that they are fake"
{{champion:104}} -"What the heck"
{{champion:4}} -"Dont be lazy, just go to the library already"

He isn't the one who made the claim that vayne can 3-shot tanks, you/the guy you agree with did, so the burden of proof would be on you to find the evidence. 

source: https://www.law.cornell.edu/wex/burden_of_proof

But if you want proof, Weiss Guertena already said it.

Vayne can 3 shot. Squishies.

Whether or not she can do this to tanks needs a lot more variables.

Like items on both sides, levels, etc.

As different scenarios are different, you can't really use overarching blanket statements such as "Vayne 3 shots" without any context UNLESS Vayne 3 shots everyone consistently at all points in the game, which is obviously not true.

He's right tho. If Vayne attacks 3 times, she deals 12% of max HP as true damage. So to be 3-shotting a tank, she also needs to deal 88% if their HP in physical damage, or almost 30% per AA. This means that, post armor, she has to do more than 1000 damage each attack. You'll agree that this is pretty much impossible unless Vayne is insanely fed and tank was AFK with disadvantage in both levels and gold.

You assume this is full builds though. Lets say each one has 3 completed items. vayne would most likely ie, shiv, and a botrk. Lets say the tank has an average amount of base armor and health.The tank has deadmans sprit visage, and sun fire. Assume ing vayne crits all 3 times and 2 of them are a Q-crit. Does a 3 shot sound that unlikely. I know she isn't gonna 3 shot a tank late game and maybe not even in this case since i don't know the exact math but i think it's possible

Only assumption I'm making is that Vayne's W is at max level. 12% max HP is 12% max HP, meaning that no matter the builds other 88% will have to come from Vayne's AA damage. Even with average HP tank will most likeli have 2.5k+ at that point, meaning Vayne will still have to do more than 700 post-mitigation damage each AA.

In your example it's still unlikely. Vayne has 50% crit and no penetration, while tank has 3 items giving fair amounts of HP; two of which have armor and third one has MR which mitigates Shiv. With 3 items both champions probably also have finished boots too; Vayne will always go Berserkers and tank will probabably have Tabis, further reducing Vayne's damage. Sure, Vayne will be able to easily 1v1 a tank due to her mobility and E, but it will surely take more than 3 AAs to do so.
